description.p: The Oath of Anarch swears paladins to ideals of liberty, collectivism and a rejection of hierarchical rulership.
Liberty. Chains imposed by unjust authority are meant to be broken.
Revolution. Change is only brought through sudden transformational struggle.
Independence. There shall be no lords over others. Power is best left in the hands of the people.
Equity. Each individual has equal worth. Hierarchies only lead to injustice.

description.p: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Divinity options.

Syndical Solidarity. You draw out collective strength among your allies in dire moments. As an action, choose up to six friendly creatures (including yourself) within 30ft of you can see or that can hear you and can understand you. Each creature gains temporary hit points equal to your paladin level

Freed From Chains. As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer of defiance. Each creature in 30ft of you that you choose can reroll a saving throw against a condition effecting them.

description.p: At 20th level, you can use an acton to take the form of a fearless revolutionary. For 1 minute you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You and friendly creatures within 30ft of you have advantage on attack rolls against a creature is there is at least one enemy of the target within 5ft of the target.
Friendly creatures that start their turn in 30ft of you have their speed increased by 15ft until the end of their turn.
You deal double damage to structures and objects.

description.p: This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or die. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
